Detailed Description

Represents a DIN rail motorcontrol module from CPR.

Definition at line 6 of file Module.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ Module()

cpr_robot::Module::Module ( Bus &  canbus,
const uint8_t  moduleId 
)

Starts a write loop that will asynchronuously send SetJoint commands to the module over the CAN bus in periodic intervals.

Parameters
canbusThe bus instance that will be used for communication.
moduleIdThe ID of the DIN rail module that will be controled.

Definition at line 279 of file Module.cpp.

◆ get_CurrentPosition()

int32_t cpr_robot::Module::get_CurrentPosition ( uint8_t &  timeStamp,
std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::time_point &  receptionTime,
uint8_t &  errorFlags,
uint8_t &  dataBits 
) const

Allows to query the last response to a SetJoint command that has been received from the module. If no response has been received yet, zero values will be returned for the current motor position, error flags and data bits.

Parameters
timeStampThe timeStamp sent by the module in the last response to a SetJoint command.
receptionTimeThe time at which the last response to a SetJoint command was received.
errorFlagsThe error flags reported by the module in the last response to a SetJoint command.
dataBitsThe data bits received from the module in the last response to a SetJoint command.
Returns
The physical motor position reported by the module in the last response to a SetJoint command.

Definition at line 257 of file Module.cpp.

◆ get_DesiredPosition()

int32_t cpr_robot::Module::get_DesiredPosition ( ) const

Allows to query the desired position of the joint that is controled by the DIN rail module.

Returns
The current desired joint position measured in encoder ticks.

◆ get_Increment()

int32_t cpr_robot::Module::get_Increment ( ) const

Gets the amount of ticks that the motor position is incremented by from one SetJoint command to the next, e.g. the speed of the motor.

Returns
Current increment measured in ticks.

◆ get_UpdateInterval()

double cpr_robot::Module::get_UpdateInterval ( ) const

Gets the interval at which periodic SetJoint commands will be sent to the module in milliseconds. This value is currently hardcoded to 50ms.

Returns
The interval measured in seconds.

Definition at line 137 of file Module.cpp.

◆ set_DesiredPosition()

void cpr_robot::Module::set_DesiredPosition ( const int32_t  ticks)

Allows to set the desired position of the joint that is controled by the DIN rail module.

Parameters
ticksThe desired joint position measured in encoder ticks. The value will be clamped to the range of valid positions.
